content.title: Scheme of Assistance for the Prevention of Alcoholism & Substance (Drugs) Abuse and for Social Defence Services: General Grant-in-Aid Programme for Financial Assistance in the Field of Social Defence
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Organizations engaged in social welfare and rehabilitation
content.details: The scheme aims to create awareness about the ill effects of alcoholism and substance abuse, providing community-based services for indemnification, motivation, counselling, de-addiction, aftercare, and rehabilitation for whole-person recovery (WPR) of addicts. It includes the General Grant-in-Aid Programme for Financial Assistance in the Field of Social Defence to support urgent needs and innovative initiatives.
benefits: Financial assistance up to 90% of approved expenditure
Support for construction, salaries, equipment, and service delivery costs
100% funding for organizations in new areas with substantial demand
eligibility: Society registered under the Indian Societies Registration Act, 1860
Public Trust registered under any law
Registered non-official organization engaged in social welfare
Universities, research institutes, schools, and statutory bodies
content.application_process: Interested organizations should complete the application in the prescribed format, attach the required documents, and send it to the designated authority. An inspection will be conducted, and grants will be disbursed in two installments.
documents_required: Statement of the problem the project aims to address
Description of services to be offered

faqs.question: How does the continuity bond ensure compliance with grant conditions?
faqs.answer: The bond obligates organizations to adhere to grant conditions, and failure to comply may lead to a refund of the grant with interest.

faqs.question: What costs are covered in maintenance charges for beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges include diet, bedding material, uniform/clothing, washing, books & stationery, and water & electricity charges.

faqs.question: How do organizations confirm the acquisition of a site for building construction?
faqs.answer: Organizations must furnish a certificate confirming the acquisition of a site; the grant cannot be used for land purchase.

faqs.question: How many years of experience should an organization have to qualify for assistance?
faqs.answer: An organization should have at least two years of experience in the related area or demonstrate competence to undertake the proposed scheme.

faqs.question: What types of organizations are eligible to apply for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible organizations include registered societies, charitable non-profit-making companies, public trusts, non-official organizations involved in social welfare, and certain statutory bodies.

faqs.question: What are the criteria for an organization to receive 100% government funding?
faqs.answer: Organizations operating in new areas with limited efforts but substantial demand may receive 100% government funding.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance can voluntary organizations receive for approved expenditure?
faqs.answer: Voluntary organizations can receive up to 90% of the approved expenditure.

faqs.question: What is the ceiling for non-recurring grant-in-aid under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The ceiling for non-recurring grant-in-aid is ₹10,00,000 per annum per project.

faqs.question: What is the limitation on the government grant for building construction?
faqs.answer: The government grant for building construction is limited to ₹10,00,000.

faqs.question: What are the eligible items for which organizations can receive assistance?
faqs.answer: Eligible items include construction of buildings, salaries of staff, equipment and furniture, delivery-related charges, stipends for trainees, and other necessary expenses.

faqs.question: What does 'whole-person recovery (WPR)' refer to?
faqs.answer: Whole-person recovery encompasses the physical, psychological, and social aspects of recovery from addiction.

faqs.question: When did the 'Scheme of Assistance for the Prevention of Alcoholism & Substance Abuse and for Social Defence Services' come into existence?
faqs.answer: The scheme came into existence on 15th October 2008.
